page.title: 04Geography of Sth Benfleet.
page.content: The plateau and the hills surrounding South Benfleet are made up of young rocks,a mixture of clay,sand or gravel,which is only about 38 million years old.Under the heavy London clay in the lower lying land there is chalk which is almost twice as old:about 65 to 70 million years.Springs,at the junction of London clay,sands and gravel gave South Benfleet is own excellent water supply.It now receives water from the Hanningfield reservoir and the pumping stations opposite the South Benfleet Primary School and the Water Tower on top of Essex Way have become redundant.They are Victorian red-brick buildings;one is now a church for the Christian Fellowship and the Water Tower a Radio Station for Essex Radio.The Water Tower is also a distinctive landmark which can be seen for miles across the country.
